A good banking app but beware if you use Lloyds for Google Pay transactions. Lloyds sets a transaction limit and if you breach that limit the transaction will be declined and Lloyds will not tell you why the transaction was declined nor what the transaction limit is. You must therefore carry your Lloyds cards with you just in case you breach the mysterious Lloyds limit they choose to apply to Google (and Apple) pay transactions. I would prefer to leave my cards at home and just use my phone.

Main reason why I switched to Monzo and was even deluded to convince my partner to do it was 3 things: shared tabs, splitting bills and control over monthly spending. It's impossible to have all of those done correctly. Simple example. I bought tickets for a flight. That was a one time off payment so I excluded it from my monthly summary. Great, it didn't count to summary. I bought those tickets for my partner as well so I've split this bill. She paid me back but I CANNOT exclude this from monthly spending summary so it adds up and actually show as an income. I've been trying to talk about it with customer service but all I got was first AI bot, then a series of sessions: sorry for waiting so long, whats your problem? this and this... I cannot help you but I'll get you someone who could help, a day later: sorry for waiting so long, what's your problem.....  Shared tab has the same flaw. Summary takes under consideration whole of your payment even after shared tab is settled. There i...
